text:
btw, the "package" field seems redundant to me, as the information is also
contained in the id. is there a scenario where the information in "package"
would be important? if not, let's get rid of it, or re-define id to only contain
the module name, not the full "path".

creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> Created an attachment (id=18535) [edit]
> added annotations and regex for package name

the regex does not work with the current naming scheme, as it does not allow
hyphens. for domain components, hyphens must be allowed, and for the module
name, they are legal but should be discouraged. modules should probably be named
like classes, i.e. AcImpl rather than ac-impl...

(In reply to comment #4)
> btw, the "package" field seems redundant to me, as the information is also
> contained in the id. is there a scenario where the information in "package"
> would be important? if not, let's get rid of it, or re-define id to only contain
> the module name, not the full "path".

there is also the question of how modules are referenced by publications.
currently, they use the old "shortname", and it even seems to work, although i
don't know why. my gut feeling says we should always use the full module name.
creator: nettings@apache.org
